item.title: By: Pinchos Chalk
item.dc:creator: Pinchos Chalk
item.description:
We certainly live in the age of imagined communities but predominantly these are bound by Claude Steiner's plastic fuzzies and not real warm ones.
That leaves us susceptible to charismatic radicalisers, which is a worry. The promise of IT is always "something new" so when social networking stops being cool people will find another way to spend their time, however.
item.content:encoded:
We certainly live in the age of imagined communities but predominantly these are bound by Claude Steiner’s plastic fuzzies and not real warm ones.

That leaves us susceptible to charismatic radicalisers, which is a worry. The promise of IT is always “something new” so when social networking stops being cool people will find another way to spend their time, however.
